alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 17 at 10:24PM MDT until April 19 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City`s East Bench affecting Salt Lake County. .Warm temperatures Sunday and Monday and rain on snow Tuesday will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For Emigration Creek...including Salt Lake City`s East Bench...the creek is peaking in action stage this evening. Flood stage is possible again Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City`s East Bench. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 130 CFS, minor flood damage will impact homes and structures along the stream, including areas of the Hogle Zoo. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Current flow is steady between 100 and 110 CFS. - Forecast...Emigration Creek will peak near action stage this evening , before flows fall below action stage once again Tuesday morning. A repeat of this cycle is expected Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning, with a chance of reaching flood stage. Peak flows near 140 cfs are possible again Tuesday evening before midnight. - Action flow is 110 cfs. - Flood flow is 130 cfs. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1015 AM MDT.
